alert.note: Alert for Atlantic; Coastal Ocean; Ocean; Southeastern Burlington (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 3:21PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Atlantic, south central Ocean and southeastern Burlington Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 321 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over New Gretna, or 16 miles north of Atlantic City, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Barnegat, Tuckerton, Surf City, Port Republic, Bass River State Forest, New Gretna, Wading River, Beach Haven West, Mystic Island, Manahawkin and Ocean Acres. This includes Garden State Parkway between mile markers 46 and 67. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southern New Jersey.

area.areaDesc: Atlantic; Coastal Ocean; Ocean; Southeastern Burlington
